Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there are a million nspv nodes, all needing to get all unconfirmed tx...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is a giant load on the network

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the design reason why the fullnodes do mempool scanning, to avoid the nspv nodes from having to relay unconfirmed tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
yes a realiable utxo cache, and a local mempool will help a lot. 
mempool might be a pretty big job lol. It needs to be done from scratch in C right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so when the overall network bandwidth is taken into consideration, that changes the optimal answer from having a local mempool to offloading it to the fullnodes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as you have experienced with bandwidth efficient header sync, the problem becomes orders of magnitude harder than just brute forcing requests to update local state

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea for nspv is to get to where a few thousand full nodes can comfortable support millions of nspv superlite clients

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the design priority. imagine we have 9600 baud modem connections and treat the bandwidth as a very precious resource

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
got it. üôÇ 
mempool could be returned with the getinfo call if it was supplied the address? 
This should make it very easy to do.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is already a  mempool message

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because nSPVC doesnt care about any other address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it has a function id and other parameters to use for searching

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: recommend to use the existing calls as mihailo is using it for CC tx creation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ü§î

Content: yes

Content:

Content: yes

Content: @CrisF

Author: CrisF#3405

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi,
Made a PR (#131) for Japanese translation.
Still have 2 questions though.  Will add to translation later.

1.  What is "Best Known Height" from `{ "BEST_HEIGHT": "Best Known Height"}`?  (left as English for now)

2.  What is `vini` from `"SPENT_VINI"`?  Found `spentvini` as "the input number of this output in the transaction that spent it" but a clear term in Japanese would help understanding.  Currently translated as `ÈÄÅ‰ø°vini`.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
best known height is the last header that the client seen from that peer that links back to the last notarization (validated) 
1 coin }
2 coin    ---> 6 coins 
3coin }
vin[0] = 1 
vin[1] = 2 
vin[2] = 3 
0,1,2 is i

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Oh, ok, thanks üëç

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am working on this Android app that connects to a full node, and I am wondering, how can I leverage some nSPV data, so that the app connecting to a full node doesn't actually have to fully "trust" that node? Is it possible to look at nSPV data and detect a malicious node giving false info? @jl777c

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can validate specific txids

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am not trying to make a superlite wallet, but maybe leverage some of the data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can also verify if a node is on the mainchain

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: interesting

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c my app would need to send p2p messages to an nSPV-enabled full node, correct?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this isn't in RPC-world

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: unfortunately the mobile app is Kotlin and the backend service is Java. Using libnspv might be "fun"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can you issue curl requests?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then you can just issue api calls to libnspv, it will need to run as its own process

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe we need a special android build of libnspv, because android cannot run arbitrary executables. They need to be in .apk format

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @ca333 maybe can share idea of turning it to an android app module etc.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: or @artem.pikulin

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: basically, how can Android apps leverage some nSPV data? We probably need to make an android app/library helper for libnspv. It' can't be compiled and used directly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: mostly it would be a wrapper around talking to full nodes via HTTP requests and parsing results

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we could probably get more android adoption if we make it easy for people

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i heard it built for android

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it can be compiled as executable binary which needs to be exected from termux app.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but if an app needs to be built, that might not be done similarly.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I done such trials from `iguana` android test days.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: wasn't working for me

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the executable doesn't give the API or don't executed in the secure sandboxed environment if I understand correctly.
